metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8690 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A logic issue existed in the handling of document loads. This issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.4, macOS Mojave 10.14.6, tvOS 12.4, Safari 12.1.2, iTunes for Windows 12.9.6, iCloud for Windows 7.13, iCloud for Windows 10.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-8690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.25.4-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.25.4-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.25.4-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.25.4-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.25.4-1ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.25.4-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.25.4-1ubuntu1').
